column1: # September-October 1847 are grouped into a single aggregate reading of 2.30 on the sheet.
# Sheet TYRain_1840-1849_E_pt1/097 actually contains data for the 1850s, not the 1840s.
# There seems to be a new gauge used from 1867 onwards.
# The 1880-1882 readings are duplicated on the first Patrington Rose Cottage sheet, but they belong to the Flax Mill site.
# The site was Enholmes Flax Mill about a mile north-west of Patrington village.
# The observer W.B.Pugh was a manager there.
# The Flax Mil closed in 1881, and readings for the site end in 1882.
# The Flax Mill location is only made explicit on the final sheet for the site, the 1880s sheet.
# The 1880s sheet also indicates that the gauge then moved to the village, where Mr Pugh continued observations at Rose Cottage.
